long_desc.thetext: this text moved to attachment #63

please attach patches to bugs, its makes them much easier to deal with.
This patch results in spurious [] charcaters using autoconf 2.13, e.g.:
[ --with-javabase=PATH set path to find jni.h in [/usr/java/include] ]
in the ./configure --help output

Hi Rob,
It seems that autoconf 2.13 is yet quoting AC_ARG_WITH function, different to autoconf 2.50+ that act as the default behaviour.
It's worse, I saw a flaw in the LIBOBJ workaround, autoconf 2.13 does not accept Quadrigraphs and so proper substitution of LTLIBOBJS is not performed.
I will submit a new patch using raw m4 functions. It's not the best way, it's a last resort when other measures have been exhausted, but... this is the case.
Regards, Carlos Velasco
Created an attachment (id=62) autoconf patch

Hi Rob,
I have solved the LIBOBJ problem. About the bad quoting problem, it seems that autoconf versions have changed the quoting, making some functions that were doing non-default quotations to the deafult: http://www.gnu.org/manual/autoconf-2.53/html_mono/autoconf.html#Changed% 20Quotation
I have solved this issue using double [[ ]] to signal the default options in configure --help
PROBLEM Improper quoting in m4 files and use of forbidden token LIBOBJS prevent autoconf other than 2.13 to generate a working configure.
SOLUTION Correct quoting has been aplied to m4 files. Quoting in ARC_ARG_ENABLE functions have been changed to different behaviour whenever autoconf 2.13 or 2.50+ is used. If you use autoconf 2.13 you will see default options for configure between double [[ ]]. If you use autoconf 2.50+ you will see default options between simple [ ]. LIBOBJS additions have been changed with AC_LIBOBJ as stated in the autoconf manual: http://www.gnu.org/manual/autoconf-2.53/html_node/AC_LIBOBJ-vs.-LIBOBJS.html
m4_pattern_allow has been used to allow LIBOBJ token, as it's needed for old LIBTOOLS.
FILES CHANGED RCS file: /cvs/src/sasl/configure.in,v RCS file: /cvs/src/sasl/saslauthd/configure.in,v RCS file: /cvs/src/sasl/config/kerberos_v4.m4,v RCS file: /cvs/src/sasl/config/plain.m4,v RCS file: /cvs/src/sasl/config/sasldb.m4,v RCS file: /cvs/src/cmulocal/sasl2.m4,v

Here's what I get using autoconf 2.13 and libtool 1.3:
aclocal -I cmulocal -I config autoheader autoconf autoconf: Undefined macros: configure.in:697: AC_LIBOBJ=([getsubopt.o]) configure.in:708: AC_LIBOBJ=([snprintf.o]) configure.in:724: AC_LIBOBJ=([getaddrinfo.o]) configure.in:737: AC_LIBOBJ=([getnameinfo.o]) automake --add-missing --include-deps lib/Makefile.am:65: @LIBOBJS@ seen but never set in `configure.in' lib/Makefile.am:58: @LTLIBOBJS@ seen but never set in `configure.in' cd saslauthd aclocal -I ../cmulocal -I config autoheader autoconf automake --add-missing --include-deps
Created an attachment (id=63) original comment

Hi Ken,
It seems that AC_LIBOBJ is not into autoconf2.13 As LIBOBJ token is allowed, not patching latest hunks should work.
Please, try the next patch.
Regards, Carlos Velasco
Created an attachment (id=64) Autoconf Patch v2

Still not working with autoconf 2.13:
./configure: line 5903: syntax error near unexpected token `m4_pattern_allow(^LIBOBJS$)' ./configure: line 5903: `m4_pattern_allow(^LIBOBJS$)'
Created an attachment (id=65) Autoconf patch v3

Hi Ken,
It seems that autoconf 2.13 hides the M4Sugar functions. I have changed the line to allow pattern only when function is available: ifdef([m4_pattern_allow],[m4_pattern_allow([^LIBOBJS$])])
Try the v3 patch.
NOTE: Remember that these patches are only for autoconf. For gcc 3 there is other patch in other bug.
Regards, Carlos Velasco

Hi Ken,
Have you tried last patch? If it works we could mark this "bug" as fixed.
Regards, Carlos Velasco
Haven't tried it yet. It might be a few days until I get to it.

The latest patch works for 2.13, but I still can't get it to work for 2.53:
ltconfig: you must specify a host type if you use `--no-verify' Try `ltconfig --help' for more information. configure: error: libtool configure failed
If I use libtool 1.4 and replace config/ltmain.sh with the one from libtool 1.4, then this problem goes away. I have no problem requiring people to use libtool 1.4 with autoconf 2.53, but we need to resolve the ltmain/ltconfig issue so that it works cleanly for both autoconf-2.13/libtool-1.3 and autoconf-2.53/libtool-1.4

Hi Ken,
ltconfig and ltmain.sh are used to generate libtool shell.
I'm not an expert with libtool, but you can reproduce the error like this:
./config/ltconfig ./config/ltmain.sh --no-verify ltconfig: you must specify a host type if you use `--no-verify' Try `ltconfig --help' for more information.
The error comes from creating the libtool script. This happen at ./configure time. I can't understand why this fails for you and works for me.
The usual would be that configure would invoke: ./config/ltconfig ./config/ltmain.sh --no-verify i586-pc-linux-gnu
with the host at then end.
I will try to find out more.
Regards, Carlos Velasco

Hi Ken,
AM_PROG_LIBTOOL
is the macro that generate libtool, which version of automake are you using?
Regards, Carlos Velasco
automake (GNU automake) 1.4-p5

Hi Ken,
With only the v3 patch applied. Can you run ./configure ... ? and after "make", do:
./config/ltconfig ./config/ltmain.sh
and then "make"
This should build the libtool packaged in CVS (1.3.5) and overwrite the built with configure.
See if this works, please.
Regards, Carlos Velasco

Hi,
Working with this problem I have seen other problems that are not exacttly related to this bug, I have opened new bug 1398 and solved the issues.
Regards, Carlos Velasco

Hi Ken,
I have been performing some research. The macro AM_PROG_LIBTOOL is generated when running aclocal -I cmulocal -I config
Special atention to "serial 46":
> grep -riB 5 -e "DEFUN.*AC_PROG_LIBTOOL" * aclocal.m4- aclocal.m4-# libtool.m4 - Configure libtool for the host system. -*-Shell- script-*- aclocal.m4- aclocal.m4-# serial 46 AC_PROG_LIBTOOL aclocal.m4- aclocal.m4:AC_DEFUN([AC_PROG_LIBTOOL], -- aclocal.m4- INCLTDL= aclocal.m4- fi aclocal.m4-]) aclocal.m4- aclocal.m4-# old names aclocal.m4:AC_DEFUN([AM_PROG_LIBTOOL], [AC_PROG_LIBTOOL])
As the macro is not into m4 files into SASL package, it finds libtool.m4 file in my own host:
> find /usr/share -name 'libtool.m4' /usr/share/aclocal/libtool.m4
Going into this file as before:
> grep -riB 5 -e "DEFUN.*AC_PROG_LIBTOOL" /usr/share/aclocal/libtool.m4 ## configuration script generated by Autoconf, you may include it under ## the same distribution terms that you use for the rest of that program.
# serial 46 AC_PROG_LIBTOOL
AC_DEFUN([AC_PROG_LIBTOOL], -- INCLTDL= fi ])
# old names AC_DEFUN([AM_PROG_LIBTOOL], [AC_PROG_LIBTOOL])
It seems clear that libtool is being generated using the aclocal macro within own system and not the one into the SASL package.
Could you try to run the ltconfig and confirm that using the libtool packaged works? If so, we could add the macro in the package to prevent aclocal to use the one in aclocal's own dir.
Regards, Carlos Velasco

Hi,
I have been doing more research about the last issue and I have reproduced the error showed by Ken.
PROBLEM The problem is that autoconf 2.50+ makes the variable $target = "" whenever autoconf 2.13 makes the variable $target = "NONE" when no --target is specified at configure time. This lead in libtool 1.3.5 to fail when building libtool script. The code for this behaviour is into libtool.m4 (libtool 1.3.5) package:
case "$target" in NONE) lt_target="$host" ;; *) lt_target="$target" ;; esac
SOLVING As libtool.m4 is generated from the host and not included in SASL package, we have two options, I have chosen the first one as it seems the easiest one. 1) so a little "work" in the target variable when it goes into libtool.m4 2) upgrading to libtool version 1.4
For the first option, we only need this little snipet added:
save_target=$target if test -z "$target"; then target="NONE" fi
CMU_PROG_LIBTOOL
target=$save_target
A successful compilation can be achieved with libtool 1.3.5 & autoconf 2.53 and with libtool 1.3.5 & autoconf 2.13
I will submit the v4 patch.
Regards, Carlos Velasco
Created an attachment (id=67) patch v4

I just committed the quoting changes, since they don't hurt anything. I didn't include the quoting changes to the default options, because in my testing, they don't seem necessary.
No matter what, I still think we're going to have a problem with libtool 1.4, unless ltmain.sh is changed, or CMU migrates to 1.4:
/bin/sh ../libtool --mode=link gcc -Wall -W -g -O2 -L/usr/local/lib -Wl,-rpath,/usr/local/lib -o makemd5 makemd5.o -lresolv libtool: ltconfig version `' does not match ltmain.sh version `1.3.5' Fatal configuration error. See the libtool docs for more information.
Do we care about supporting libtool 1.4? If not, then I can commit your two other fixes to make autoconf 2.53 work.

Hi Ken,
You missed the fourth hunk in saslauthd/configure.in file.
If you don't apply the patch into the default options the [] signaling defaults are missing when you use autoconf 2.50+
autoconf 2.50+ --enable-cmulocal enable local mods for CMU no
autoconf 2.13 --enable-cmulocal enable local mods for CMU [no]
There is no simple solution as the functions have changed from autoconf 2.1 to autoconf 2.50+ (really autoconf 2.50+ follow the correct quoting rules). The only two solutions are: 1) Use other characters as default (like <>) 2) Double quoting, that have diferente behaviour depending on autoconf version used.
I chosed the second one, and then:
autoconf 2.50+ --enable-cmulocal enable local mods for CMU [no]
autoconf 2.13 --enable-cmulocal enable local mods for CMU [[no]]
I think we should submit the patches right now working with libtool 1.3 and try to solve libtool 1.3-1.4 problem in another bug. I think we could modify Makefile.am to actualize libtool depending on libtool installed on host.
Regards, Carlos Velasco

Hi,
Another patch for the libtool problem As told, problem is that libtool.m4 reside in the host (tipically /usr/shace/aclocal/libtool.m4) and not in the packaged SASL , this tend to change the behaviour depending on the libtool installed.
As stated in the libtool manual, we should include libtool macros into acinclude.m4 (generate this new file): http://www.gnu.org/software/libtool/manual.html#AM_PROG_LIBTOOL
" When you invoke the libtoolize program (see Invoking libtoolize), it will tell you where to find a definition of AM_PROG_LIBTOOL. If you use Automake, the aclocal program will automatically add AM_PROG_LIBTOOL support to your configure script.
Nevertheless, it is advisable to include a copy of libtool.m4 in acinclude.m4, so that, even if aclocal.m4 and configure are rebuilt for any reason, the appropriate libtool macros will be used. The alternative is to hope the user will have a compatible version of libtool.m4 installed and accessible for aclocal. This may lead to weird errors when versions don't match. "
Generated this new file, I have tried it with both autolocal 1.4-p5 and autolocal 1.6.3 and it works.
This way, we force to always use the packaged libtool version in SASL, not the host depending one.
Regards, Carlos Velasco

I've committed the libtool.m4 (as acinclude.m4) that we use at CMU to be consistant with the libtool in the distribution... Hopefully this will also solve some brokenness we found in the redhat libtool.m4

The libtool.m4 fix seems to work on both my autoconf 2.13/libtool 1.3.5 (RH) box and my autoconf 2.53/libtool 1.4.2 box.
I also committed the rest of the fixes to make autoconf 2.53 work. All that is left is changing the default option quoting.

FYI, I had to add --cache-file=./config.cache to my configure line on my autoconf 2.53 (RH) setup, otherwise the plugins failed to load (just like with the broken RH libtool). I don't know if this is a broken RHism or caching is off by default on autoconf 2.53.

Hi Ken,
caching is off by default in autoconf 2.50+ http://www.gnu.org/manual/autoconf-2.53/html_mono/autoconf.html#Cache%20Files
However it seems that certain checks (libtool) complains about using /dev/null (no cache).
You can apply next patch to apply ./config.cache as the default file for caching.
I'm still doing some research with the default options.
Regards, Carlos Velasco
Created an attachment (id=70) default cache file - patch

Hi,
At last I have developed a good patch for "the defaults". I have used the macro "m4_PACKAGE_VERSION" that defines the autoconf version used and is only present in autoconf 2.50+ (so far) If it's present we substitute the default macros for calling them with double quoting:
ifdef([m4_PACKAGE_VERSION], [define([AC_ARG_ENABLE_HACK], defn([AC_ARG_ENABLE])) define([AC_ARG_ENABLE], [AC_ARG_ENABLE_HACK([$1], [[$2]], [$3], [$4])]) define([AC_ARG_WITH_HACK], defn([AC_ARG_WITH])) define([AC_ARG_WITH], [AC_ARG_WITH_HACK([$1], [[$2]], [$3], [$4])])])
For autoconf 2.13 or older, we don't do anything as the m4_PACKAGE_VERSION macro is not defined.
Regards, Carlos velasco
Created an attachment (id=71) defaults quoting

I think I'd rather leave the defaults quoting broken with autoconf 2.5x then bend over backwards with some nasty hack to make it work both ways. (I'd then open a bug for just the defaults quoting, which we'd close when we transitioned to using 2.53 for everything).

Hi Rob,
The "defaults" patch work in both autoconf versions. It just translate the help strings to double quotings when you use autoconf 2.50+ If you use autoconf 2.13 no translation is performed and all run smoothly.
Regards, Carlos Velasco

Hi,
sasl/saslauthd/config/install-sh sasl/saslauthd/config/missing
These files should be removed from CVS as they are from specific versions and they are added automatically when invoking automake (SMakefile) as it does in another dirs:
automake --add-missing --include-deps configure.in: installing `config/install-sh' configure.in: installing `config/mkinstalldirs' configure.in: installing `config/missing'
Regards, Carlos Velasco

Hi,
I have found an odd issue when using autoconf 2.50+ After compiling and installing all seems to work right, you can use saslpasswd2 and sasldblistusers2. However when you try to authenticate with cyrus imapd:
auth:debug pop3: pop3[9328]: could not find auxprop plugin, was searching for \'[all]\' auth:debug pop3: pop3[9328]: could not find auxprop plugin, was searching for \'[all]\'
It seems that SASL can't see any mechs installed. It happens when I use current CVS image and autoconf 2.50+
Can anyone reproduce this issue?
Regards, Carlos Velasco

Hi,
I have found out the problem. In config.h file:
/* Does libtool support shared libs on this system? */ #define HAVE_DLFCN_H 1 /* #undef DO_DLOPEN */
DO_DLOPEN shoud be defined but it isn't.
in configure.in: if test "$ac_cv_can_build_shared" = yes; then AC_DEFINE(DO_DLOPEN) fi
As in autoconf 2.50+ defualt is NO CACHE, this check fails, and DO_DLOPEN is not defined.
I think that "default cache file - patch" should be applied as soon as posible, because this and other tests could be failing in autoconf 2.50+ as we are asking for cv (cache variables) in local scripts.
WORKAROUND: using configure -C [parameters] when building Makefile.
Regards, Carlos Velasco
committed the default cache file patch. Obsoleting old patches that are no longer applicable.
currently modern versions use autoconf > 2.50
